author: Natalia Drozdiak
title: What Lessons Can Washington Learn From Europe About Regulation of Tech Firms?
text:
U.S. lawmakers this week set the stage for a possible new era of regulation for big tech companies as they questioned Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg about the companyâ€™s handling of user privacy.
They offered few specifics about what type of oversight they would favor for an industry that has up to now been governed in the U.S. with a light touch. But as they mull how and whether to pursue regulation to address increasing concerns, including about digital privacy, they might look to Europe to seek answers and...
